handDesc.p: Halantas. T looks like a full-sized ta without a headmark (l21, l47); some specimens also have a short vertical tail, e.g. l21 balāT. N looks like a simplified and slightly reduced na without a headmark, with the top extended in a short tail slanting to the right (l10, l11, l17, l20 etc). M seems to be a circle without a tail, as in l22 bhuvaM. Rangacharya apparently sees no instances of final M in this text, but I am quite certain some final anusvāras in his edition are actually M.
Original punctuation marks are plain straight verticals, a character body in height.

Other palaeographic observations. Anusvāra is a dot after the character to which it belongs, placed at midline height or lower. Dependent o occurs both in the single-stroke cursive form and as two separate strokes. The cursive form (e.g. l2 gotrā°) has low humps identical on both sides, and a short tail descending barely below headline (but some instances, e.g. l16 kollabi°, have a longer tail, while others have none, ending well above headline, e.g. l18 tanayo). Dependent au (e.g. l3 kauśiki) does not differ conspicuously from cursive o and is read on the basis of context, without flagging as an erroneous o. The character dha is consistently written to look like va (e.g. (l1)). I, like Rangacharya, treat these as unclear instances of dha. Although most look like perfect specimens of va, not imperfect specimens of dha, there is also an instance of tha that looks like va with a dot in it (l6), while a normal-shaped tha occurs in l62. Because of this variation, I accept the va-like outline as an alternative form used by the scribe in question.

projectDesc.p: This project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_V01.xml file.

div.head: Plates
div.p:
svasti. śriīmatāṁ sakala-bhūuvana-saṁstūyamāna-maānavya-sagotrāṇāṁ hāriti
-putrāṇāṁ kauśikiī-vara-prasaāda-labdha-rājyānām mātr̥-gaṇa-paripālitānāṁ svaāmi
-mahāsena-pādānudhyaātānāṁ bhagavan-nārāyaṇa-prasāda-samāsādi
ta-vara-varāha-lāṁchanekṣaṇa-kṣaṇa-vaśīkr̥tārāti-maṇḍalānām aśvamedhā
vabhr̥tha-snāna-pavitriīkr̥ta-vapuṣāṁ cālukyānāṁ kulam alaṁkarigaṣnos saṁtyāśraya-va
llabhendrasya pratā kubja-viṣṇuṣṇuvi-satyaśrāya-vallabhendrasya bhrātā kubja-viṣṇuvarddha
no| ’ṣṭādaśa-varṣāṇi veṁgī-deśam apaālayaT| tat-putro jayasiṁha-vallabhas traya
striṁśataṁ| tad-anujendrarājas sapta dināni| tan-nandano viṣṇuvarddhano nava saṁvva
tsarāN| tat-tokam maṁgi-yuvarājaḥ paṁca-viṁśakrtimaM| tat-auraso jayasiṁhas trayodaśa|
tad-dvaimaāturānujaḥ kokkiliḥ ṣaṇ māsāN| tasya jyaeṣṭho bhrātā viṣṇuvarddha
ddhanas tam upytpāṭya saptatriṁśad varṣāṇi| tad-āapatyaṁ vijayāditya-bhaṭṭaārako ’ṣṭā
daśa| tad-ātmajo viṣṇuvarddhanaḥ ṣaṭtriṁśataṁ| tat-tanujo narendra-vijayādityaḥ
Aṣṭacatvāriṁśataṁ| tat-putraṁḥ kali-viṣṇuvarddhano ’dhyarddha-varṣaṁ| tad-ātmajo gu
ṇakkenalla-vijayādityaś catuścatvāriṁśataṁ| tad-anuja-voikramāditya-sū
nuś cālukya-bhīmas triṁśataṁ| tat-putraḥ kollabigaṇḍa-vijayādityaḥ ṣa
ṇ māsāN| tat-suūnur ammarājas sapta varṣāni| tat-suto bheka-vijayādityaḥ pa
kṣaṁ| ntatas tāḻapa-rājo māsaṁ| taṁ jitvā cālukya-bhīma-tanayo
vikramādityas saṁvatsaraṁ|

lg.l:
sāmanta-śabara-vallabha-daṇḍāś cānyoe
ca bhuvam aluṁpann abdāN

saptāśantaroe ’tra mallarapa-rāja-kr̥taṁ paṭṭa-bandham ava
matya balāT|

Face IIIa. tasya dvaimāturaḥ kṣmāṁ 2185 sakala-jana-mude vallabhādāptarājyo bhaimo dānārṇṇav2186eśo [+’]py avati manu-nayāt aṁkidevi-tanūjaḥ[+||] (4) vaidagdhyaṁ vachorasya2187 vāriruha-saṁbhūtasya bhū-devatā grāmyāt vākalitaṁ kalāsu gaditaṁ vāg-aṁga-nāyā2188 api[+|] strī-naisarggika2189-cāpalāspadatayā nindārham ity ādarā[d*] [u*]dvaidagdhyam alaṁ kalāsu sakalais saṁstūyate sajjanaiḥ[+||] (5) sthirāpi śaśvad bhramati trilokīṁ jana[na*]nurāgaṁ kurute sitāpi[+|] vicitra-rūpeti sadā2190 vi[śi*]ṣṭair vvicāryate kīrtti-latā yadīyā[+||] (6)
Face IIIb. sa samasta-bhuvanāśraya-śrī-vijayāditya-mahārāja-para[me*]śvara-parama-bhaṭṭārakaḥ parama-brahmaṇyo nātavāḍi-viṣaya-nivāsino rāṣṭrakūṭa-pramukhān kuṭuṁbinas samāhūya mantri-purohita-senapati-yuva[rā*]jādy aṣṭādaśa-tīrth2191ādhyakṣam ittham ājñāpayati2192[+||] śrī-saṁbhūti-nimitte muktāphala2193-puruṣa2194-ratna-saṁyuktam[+|] sāma[nta*]-voḍḍi-saṁjñaṁ [ku*]lam āsīj jalanidhi-pratimam[+||] (7) tad-vaṁśa-vārinidhi-vr̥iddhikaraḥ2195 karāsi nirddāri2196-cāṭa-bala-vī[ra*2197-bhaṭ-ā*]ndhakāraḥ[+|] āsīt śa[śām*]̇ka iva2198 guṇḍiya-rāṣṭrakūṭo saṁpūjya2199 sat-pa[tha*]-gati-pravaṇaḥ2200 sva2201-vr̥ttaḥ[+||] (8) śrīmac kubalukya-vaṁśodita bhūmipāla-śrīdvāra-madhyānugataṁ praviśya[+|] nanu vipad-vāramamaviśami tyakṣaṣṭavātaṁ gata-Vallabheśam 2202// (9)
Face IVa. samasta-satyādi-guṇaprapannaḥ paropakāra-pravaṇaprabhāvaḥ[+|] abhūd arātīndhana-vahnir ugras tad2203-ātmabhūr eṟiya-rāṣṭrakūṭaḥ[+||] (10) turaṁgam2204 ārohaṇa-kauśalena2205 tiraskr̥t2206ānindita-vatsato-be-/ tiya-nāmadheyas2207 samasta-saṁpan nilayas tadīya[ḥ*][+||] (11)2208 tasya śrī-va[ndya*]nāṁb[yā*]m abhava(va)d bhava-sannibhaḥ[+|] samasta-saṁpan-nilayo guṇḍ̣yanā(ta)khyaḥ sutottamaḥ[+||] (12) pratāpāyya [ci*]tām eti virodhi-timirāpahaḥ[+|] nityaṁ padmākarārādhyo yasya (ga) tejo virocanaḥ[+||] (13) tena kākatya-guṇḍyana-nāmadheyena2209 prārtthyamānair asmābhiḥ[+|] velapaṟṟu-mahā-grāma-vāstavyo2210 vadataṁ varaḥ[+|] kutsa-gotrābhisaṁbhū[to*] ciddimayyaḥ pur-ābhavat[+||] (14) śrīdharāṁghri-dvayāṁboja-sevī śrīdhara-saṁjñayā[+|] viśrutas tat-suto jātyā bhūdeva[ḥ*] śrīdhara-śriyā[+||] (15) tasyābhūn mācemāṁbāyāṁ sūnur ddommana-saṁjñakaḥ 2211[+|]
Face IVb. samasta-gu[ṇa*]2212-saṁpannas2213 sat-sādhu-jana-vatsalaḥ[+||] (16) [śru*]ti-[smr̥iti*]-sadācāra-purāṇ2214oditavartmani[+|] durāpo2215-nyaja(sa)nair-nnityaṁ yasy-ācā(vi)raḥ pravarttate2216[+||] (17) kākatya2217-guṇḍyanaṁ vīram uddiśyāha[ḥ*]pati2218prabham[+|] yena karppatam2219 āba[ddhaṁ*] tat2220-prasādābhikāṁkṣinā[+||] (18) prāta[s*] snānaṁ pratidinaṁ 2221 brahmacaryya[m2222 a*]khaṇḍitam[+|] gatyādi yenācaritaṁ karppaṭī2223-vratam ādarāt[+||] (19) satyaṁ śaucan dayā dānam anuṣṭhānam2224 udāra-dhīḥ[+|] kṣāntis saujanyam ityādi yad upajñam iha kalau[+||] (20)

div.p:
tasmay ātmano nāmnā2225 māṁgallu-nāma-grāmas sarvva2226-kara-parihāreṇa udaka-pūrvvam uttarāyaṇa-nimittaṁ agrahārīkr̥tyā(tt)smābhir datta iti2227 viditam astu vaḥ[+||] asyāvadhayaḥ[+||]
Face Va. pūrvvataḥ koḍupulūri2228 polagarusuna yilindi-guṇṭa[+||] āgneyataḥ kuṟṟalabola pannasa[+||] dakṣiṇataḥ laṁjayamāḍa sīmā[+||] nairr̥ityataḥ munna-nadī2229[+||] paścimataḥ pallikaṇṭī-bhaṭāraṇḍu[+||] vāyavyataḥ muyyalukaṭṭu[+||] uttarataḥ koṇḍṟūri polagarusuna cintalu[+||] īśānataḥ2230 muyyalukuṭṭuna pūla-gudla-guṇṭa[+||] asyoparī na [kena*]cid bādhā kartta[vyā*] yaḥ karoti sa paṁca-mahāpātaka-saṁyukto bhavati// tathoktaṁ vyāsena[+||] bahubhir vvasudhā dattā bahubhiś cānupālitā2231[+|] yasya yasya yadā bhūmis tasya tasya tadā phalam[+||] (21) sva-dattāṁ para-dattāṁ vā yo haretā vasundharām[+|] ṣaṣṭi-[va*]rṣa-sahasrāṇi vi[ṣṭā*]yāṁ jāyate kr̥miḥ[+||] (22) sarvvan etān bhāvinaḥ 2232 pārthivendrān bhūyo bhūyo yācate rāmabhadraḥ [+|]
Face Vb. sāmānyo yan dharmma-setur nnr̥pāṇāṁ kāle kāle pālanīyo bhavadbhiḥ[+||] (23) ājñaptiḥ kaḍakarājaḥ[+||] potanabhaṭṭa-kr̥tiḥ[+||]

app.note: The vowel mark for ā is extended downward in a curve much like that for subscript r. This may be an ornamental extension of the stroke or an error made by an illiterate scribe, but it is definitely not a subscript y.

At this locus, Rangacharya marks the text from pratā to vallabhendrasya as superfluous. There is no way to tell which iteration of the (imperfectly) repeated string was inscribed in error, but since the second instance of vallabhendrasya contains a scribal correction (see next apparatus entry), I understand that its presence in the text was approved by a contemporary editor and it is the first iteration that was dismissed.
The addition is written below the line and to the right of bha, i.e. one character to the right of where I would expect it to be.

div.p: Reported in 6A/1916-19171 with a description at 115-11624. First edited from inked impressions by V. Rangacharya (), with facsimiles but without translation. The present edition by Dániel Balogh is based on a collation of Rangacharya's edition and his facsimiles.No image of the seal is available.
